title: Arpeggio: 9th in D (Shape: C)
content:
# Arpeggio: 9th in D (Shape: C)

An arpeggio is the playing of the tones of a chord in quick succession rather than simultaneously. In this instance, we are looking at the 9th arpeggio in the key of D, using the shape of a C chord.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (root)
- F# (3rd)
- A (5th)
- C# (7th)
- E (9th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio, with the added 9th note, creates a dreamy and somewhat mystical sound. It is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and progressive rock music to add depth and color to chords and melodies.

## Songs
- "Europa" by Santana
- "Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones
- "Chameleon" by Herbie Hancock
